sys_hub_action_type_definition.description:
Restarts the specified Autonomous Database.

Inputs :

  • Compartment ID - The OCID of the compartment of the Autonomous Database.
  • Database ID - The database OCID.

Outputs :

  • Status - If the request is executed successfully, Status is set to "Success". If there is a failure, Status is set to "Error".
  • Error Message - Reason for error, along with code. Populated only when an error occurs.
  • Compartment ID - The OCID of the compartment of the Autonomous Database.
  • Display Name - The user-friendly name for the Autonomous Database. The name does not have to be unique
  • Database ID - The database OCID.
  • Database Name - The database name.
  • Database Version - A valid Oracle Database version for Autonomous Database.
  • Database Workload - The Autonomous Database workload type.
  • Service Console URL - The URL of the Service Console for the Autonomous Database.
  • Lifecycle State - The current state of the Autonomous Database
  • Time Created - The date and time the Autonomous Database was created.
  • CPU Core Count - The number of OCPU cores to be made available to the database.
  • Data Storage Size in TBs - The quantity of data in the database, in terabytes.
  • License Model - The Oracle license model that applies to the Oracle Autonomous Database.
  • Database Details - The entire JSON response comprising the database information.

Error Messages :

  • Bad Request.
  • Unauthorized.
  • Not Found.
  • Internal Server Error.

To use this action, the corresponding Oracle connection and credential must be created and associated with the Oracle Connection & Credential alias. Learn More

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.
sys_hub_action_type_definition.name: Restart Database
